questions.article:
The following text is adapted from Anton Chekhov's 1904 play The Cherry Orchard (translated by Julius West in 1916).

TROFIMOV: Believe me, Anya, believe me! I'm not thirty yet, I'm young. I'm still a student, but I have undergone a great deal! I'm as hungry as the winter, I'm ill, I'm shaken... and where haven't I been—fate has tossed me everywhere!
questions.question: As used in the text, what does the word "undergone" most nearly mean?

options.name: A
options.content: Neglected

options.name: B
options.content: Enjoyed

options.name: C
options.content: Conveyed

options.name: D
options.content: Endured

questions.correct: Endured
questions.solution:
这段文字改编自安东·契诃夫（Anton Chekhov）1904年的戏剧《樱桃园》（The Cherry Orchard，由朱利叶斯·韦斯特于1916年翻译）。文中特罗菲莫夫（TROFIMOV）说：“相信我，安雅，相信我！我还不到三十岁，我还年轻。我还是个学生，但我经历（undergone）了很多！我像冬天一样饥饿，我生病了，我颤抖……命运把我抛到了各处！” 题目是问文中“undergone”这个词最接近的意思。
选项A“Neglected”（忽视、疏忽），与文中表达的经历很多事情的意思不符，A选项错误。
选项B“Enjoyed”（享受），从文中“我像冬天一样饥饿，我生病了，我颤抖”等内容可知，不是享受的意思，B选项不正确。
选项C“Conveyed”（传达、传递），不能准确表达出经历的含义，C选项不合适。
选项D“Endured”（忍受、忍耐），与文中特罗菲莫夫所说的经历了很多艰难困苦相呼应，D选项正确。
所以正确答案是D。

questions.article: Indigenous Photograph is an organization whose mission is to ensure that images of indigenous peoples in the media are presented from indigenous perspectives. The organization ______ this commitment by promoting the works of artist Geremew Tigabu (Ethiopian, Amhara, and Tigre) and other prominent indigenous photographers who document and reflect Indigenous lives and experiences.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise word or phrase?

options.name: A
options.content: concludes

options.name: B
options.content: explains

options.name: C
options.content: precedes

options.name: D
options.content: shows

questions.correct: shows
questions.solution:
这段文字介绍了“土著摄影”（Indigenous Photograph）是一个组织，其使命是确保媒体中土著民族的形象从土著视角呈现。该组织通过推广艺术家杰里梅·提加布（Geremew Tigabu，埃塞俄比亚人，阿姆哈拉族和提格雷族）以及其他记录和反映土著生活和经历的著名土著摄影师的作品来展示（shows）这一承诺。
题目是让选择一个最符合逻辑和精确的词或短语来完成文本。
选项A“concludes”（得出结论、结束），组织推广摄影师作品不是得出结论或结束，A选项不符合语境。
选项B“explains”（解释），文中强调的是通过实际行动来体现承诺，而不是解释承诺，B选项不太恰当。
选项C“precedes”（先于、在……之前），与文意不符，不是说组织在承诺之前做某事，C选项错误。
选项D“shows”（展示、显示），准确地表达了组织通过推广摄影师作品来展示其对使命的承诺，D选项正确。 所以正确答案是D。

questions.article: Although fewer companies trade their stocks on the Cambodia Securities Exchange in Phnom Penh, Cambodia, than on the stock exchanges in London, Mumbai, or Tokyo, the Cambodia Securities Exchange has the advantage of being able to ______ relatively small companies in Cambodia: by connecting those companies to investors with expertise about the country's economic conditions, the Cambodia Securities Exchange can help those companies thrive.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise word or phrase?

options.name: A
options.content: designate

options.name: B
options.content: nurture

options.name: C
options.content: preclude

options.name: D
options.content: assess

questions.correct: nurture
questions.solution:
这段文字提到，虽然在柬埔寨金边的柬埔寨证券交易所（Cambodia Securities Exchange）交易股票的公司比在伦敦、孟买或东京的证券交易所少，但柬埔寨证券交易所有能够培育（nurture）柬埔寨相对较小的公司的优势：通过将这些公司与对该国经济状况有专业知识的投资者联系起来，柬埔寨证券交易所可以帮助这些公司蓬勃发展。
题目是让选择一个最符合逻辑和精确的词或短语来完成文本。
选项A“designate”（指定、指派），与帮助小公司发展的语境不符，A选项错误。
选项B“nurture”（培育、培养），准确地表达了证券交易所对小公司的扶持和帮助其成长的意思，B选项正确。
选项C“preclude”（排除、阻止），与文意相悖，不是阻止小公司发展，C选项不合适。
选项D“assess”（评估、评定），只是评估不能体现出帮助公司发展的意思，D选项不准确。 所以正确答案是B。

questions.article: The emphasis on accurately representing the experiences of average working people that is characteristic of the realist style can be seen in The Gleaners, painted by Jean-Francois Millet, which depicts peasants picking stray wheat from a field after the harvest. This style can thus be seen as an effort to ______ what were regarded as the excesses of the romantic style evident in many paintings by Horace Vernet, which instead exaggerated their subjects' beauty or heroism while hiding all imperfection.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise word or phrase?

options.name: A
options.content: understand

options.name: B
options.content: advance

options.name: C
options.content: counteract

options.name: D
options.content: accentuate

questions.correct: counteract
questions.solution:
翻译：
让・弗朗索瓦・米勒所绘的《拾穗者》体现了现实主义风格注重准确呈现普通劳动者经历的特点，该作品描绘了农民在收获后从田间捡拾散落麦穗的场景。因此，这种风格可被视为是对贺拉斯韦尔内众多画作中明显的浪漫主义风格过度之处的一种____，后者往往夸大描绘对象的美貌或英雄气概，同时掩盖所有缺陷。
  • A 选项 “understand” ：意思是 “理解” 。现实主义风格并非是去理解浪漫主义风格的过度之处，不符合语境。
  • B 选项 “advance” ：意为 “推进；促进” 。现实主义风格不是为了推进浪漫主义风格的过度之处，该选项不合适。
  • C 选项 “counteract” ：表示 “对抗；抵消” 。现实主义风格强调真实呈现，与浪漫主义风格夸大和掩盖缺陷形成对比，是对浪漫主义风格过度之处的一种对抗，该选项符合文意。
  • D 选项 “accentuate” ：意思是 “强调；突出” 。现实主义风格不是为了突出浪漫主义风格的过度之处，不符合逻辑。
综上，正确答案是 C

questions.article: The swordfish can swim very fast—up to 97 kilometers per hour (km/hr)—but it is significantly slower than the frigatebird, which can fly at speeds up to 153 km/hr. The difference between these speeds is largely ______ of the fact that the features that make flight possible do less to limit top speeds than the features suitable for swimming through water.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise word or phrase?

options.name: A
options.content: a consequence

options.name: B
options.content: an explanation

options.name: C
options.content: a repudiation

options.name: D
options.content: an objective

questions.correct: a consequence

questions.article: President Richard Nixon is most famous for his participation in the 1970s Watergate political scandal, a convoluted tale of criminality and eroded ethics involving a constellation of associates such as security operative Jack Caulfield and Attorney General John Mitchell. But Nixon's legacy is complex: he has been praised for his role in affirming the sovereignty of tribal nations, and he once made an attempt at reforming United States health care policy that is arguably a precursor to the Affordable Care Act, which became law during the Barack Obama administration.
questions.question: Which choice best describes the function of the underlined sentence in the text as a whole?

options.name: A
options.content: It presents an accomplishment of a historical figure whose significance is detailed later in the text.

options.name: B
options.content: It describes a common perception of a historical figure that is challenged by information presented later in the text.

options.name: C
options.content: It states a claim about a historical figure that is supported by evidence later in the text.

options.name: D
options.content: It compares the achievements of three historical figures to a fourth that is mentioned later in the text.

questions.correct: It describes a common perception of a historical figure that is challenged by information presented later in the text.
questions.solution:
翻译：
理查德・尼克松总统最为人熟知的是他在 20 世纪 70 年代水门政治丑闻中的牵涉，这是一个充斥着犯罪行为和道德败坏的复杂事件，涉及安保人员杰克・考菲尔德和司法部长约翰・米切尔等一众相关人员。但尼克松的历史遗产是复杂的：他因在确认部落民族主权方面的作用而受到赞扬，并且他曾尝试改革美国医疗保健政策，这可以说是巴拉克・奥巴马政府期间通过的《平价医疗法案》的前身。
解析：
  • 划线句指出尼克松因参与水门丑闻而广为人知，这是大众对他的普遍看法。但后文提到他在确认部落民族主权及医疗保健政策改革方面的贡献，说明他并非只有负面形象，对前文大众的普遍看法形成了挑战。
  • A 选项：划线句说的是尼克松的负面事件，并非成就，该选项错误。
  • B 选项：准确指出划线句描述了对尼克松的普遍看法，且被后文信息所挑战，符合文意。
  • C 选项：后文不是支持划线句中关于尼克松因丑闻出名这一说法，而是呈现了他的其他方面，该选项错误。
  • D 选项：文中未对三个历史人物的成就与第四个进行比较，该选项错误。
综上，正确答案是 B

questions.article: In what is now Washington state, the Tulalip Tribes operate the Hibulb Cultural Center. Relying on traditional knowledge to guide the design of exhibits, this institution presents Tulalip history and culture to the tribes' citizens. The Comanche Nation, a tribe in Oklahoma, employs a similar strategy in its own cultural center. Both centers contrast with museums that aren't Indigenous-led; when displaying Indigenous artifacts, such museums tend to anticipate mainly non-Indigenous audiences and rely on Euro-centric strategies for designing exhibits.
questions.question: Which choice best describes the function of the underlined sentence in the text as a whole?

options.name: A
options.content: It suggests improvements to a particular tribal cultural center.

options.name: B
options.content: It encourages tribal citizens to attend their local cultural center.

options.name: C
options.content: It explains how one tribal cultural center differs from other tribal cultural centers.

options.name: D
options.content: It provides a basic description of a particular tribal cultural center.

questions.correct: It provides a basic description of a particular tribal cultural center.
questions.solution:
翻译：
在如今的华盛顿州，塔拉利波部落运营着希布尔文化中心。该机构依靠传统知识来指导展览设计，向部落公民展示塔拉利波的历史和文化。俄克拉荷马州的科曼奇部落也在其文化中心采用了类似策略。这两个文化中心与非原住民主导的博物馆形成鲜明对比；在展示原住民文物时，这类博物馆主要面向非原住民观众，并采用以欧洲为中心的展览设计策略。
解析：
  • 划线句介绍了希布尔文化中心依靠传统知识指导展览设计，向部落公民展示塔拉利波历史文化，是对这个特定部落文化中心基本情况的描述。
  • A 选项：文中未提及对特定部落文化中心的改进建议，该选项错误。
  • B 选项：划线句没有鼓励部落公民前往当地文化中心的意思，该选项错误。
  • C 选项：文中说科曼奇部落文化中心采用类似策略，重点不是说该中心与其他部落文化中心的差异，该选项错误。
  • D 选项：准确指出划线句是对特定部落文化中心的基本描述，符合文意。
综上，正确答案是 D

questions.article: The Museum of Modern Art (MOMA) in New York City has an exhibition of video games that includes Pac-Man from 1980, which museum visitors can play on site, and SimCity 2000 from 1994, which visitors can see only in a video presentation. MOMA claims the video presentations are only for games that would be impractical to display in a playable form, but video games are an inherently interactive medium, a feature that is grossly absent in a video-only presentation.
questions.question: Which choice best describes the function of the underlined sentence in the text as a whole?

options.name: A
options.content: It identifies a feature of many video games that is not shared by some of the games included in MOMA's exhibition.

options.name: B
options.content: It provides a claim about video games as art that both MOMA and the author accept as true.

options.name: C
options.content: It describes a misconception about video games that the author believes is evident in MOMA's choice about which video games to exhibit.

options.name: D
options.content: It presents a consideration that the author thinks partly undermines MOMA's approach to exhibiting video games.

questions.correct: It presents a consideration that the author thinks partly undermines MOMA's approach to exhibiting video games.
questions.solution:
翻译：
纽约现代艺术博物馆（MOMA）举办了一场电子游戏展览，其中包括 1980 年的《吃豆人》，参观者可以在现场游玩；还有 1994 年的《模拟城市 2000》，参观者只能通过视频展示观看。MOMA 称视频展示仅用于那些难以以可玩形式展出的游戏，但电子游戏本质上是一种互动媒介，而仅通过视频展示的方式完全缺乏这一特性。
解析：
  • 划线句指出电子游戏本质是互动媒介，而 MOMA 部分游戏仅以视频展示，缺乏互动性。这体现出作者认为 MOMA 这种展览方式存在问题，划线句内容削弱了 MOMA 展览某些电子游戏的方式。
  • A 选项：重点并非在说部分游戏不具备互动性这一特征，而是在指出 MOMA 展览方式的不足，该选项错误。
  • B 选项：文中未提及关于电子游戏作为艺术的主张，且 MOMA 和作者并非都认同此内容，该选项错误。
  • C 选项：文中没有说 MOMA 对电子游戏存在误解，该选项错误。
  • D 选项：准确表明划线句呈现了作者认为会部分地削弱 MOMA 展览电子游戏方式的因素，符合文意。
综上，正确答案是 D

questions.article: In O'odham, an Indigenous language from the Southwest region of what is now the United States, gogs means "a dog", whereas gogogs is used to refer to several dogs. This phenomenon, in which an element of a root word is repeated, sometimes with modification, within another word that is related to the root word, is called reduplication. In this case, the element "go" in gogs gets repeated in gogogs. There are many examples of this type of reduplication in O'odham.
questions.question: The text makes which point about the O'odham word gogogs?

options.name: A
options.content: It contains a repetition of the element "go" in gogs.

options.name: B
options.content: It doesn't have a clear equivalent in English.

options.name: C
options.content: It is the only word in O'odham that uses reduplication.

options.name: D
options.content: It is identical in meaning to several other words in O'odham.

questions.correct: It contains a repetition of the element "go" in gogs.

questions.article: Master and Commander, first published in 1969, is a novel in Patrick O'Brian's Aubrey Maturin series, which includes twenty completed books. Some critics have found fault with the abrupt endings of Master and Commander and other books in the series, saying that they do not finish conclusively but arbitrarily stop. Other critics, however, argue that the books should not be thought of as discrete texts with traditional beginnings and endings but as a single incredibly long work, similar to other multivolume stories, such as John Galsworthy's The Forsyte Saga.
questions.question: Which choice best states the main purpose of the text?

options.name: A
options.content: The unusual structure that O'Brian uses for Master and Commander makes it one of his most intricate books.

options.name: B
options.content: Critics have differing views regarding the efficacy of the structures of the novels in the Aubrey Maturin series.

options.name: C
options.content: Some critics think the Aubrey/Maturin series should have the literary renown of The Forsyte Saga, while others disagree.

options.name: D
options.content: Many critics judge the Aubrey/Maturin novels to be remarkably entertaining despite flaws in the novels' structures.

questions.correct: Critics have differing views regarding the efficacy of the structures of the novels in the Aubrey Maturin series.
questions.solution:
翻译：
《怒海争锋》于 1969 年首次出版，是帕特里克・奥布莱恩所著的奥伯里 - 马图林系列小说中的一部，该系列共有二十部已完成的作品。一些评论家对《怒海争锋》及该系列其他书籍的突兀结局表示不满，称这些结局并非有结论性的收尾，而是随意中断。然而，另一些评论家则认为，这些书籍不应被视为具有传统开头和结尾的独立文本，而应被看作是一部篇幅极长的作品，类似于其他多卷本故事，如约翰・高尔斯华绥的《福尔赛世家》。
解析：
  • 文本主要阐述了对于奥伯里 - 马图林系列小说结构，评论家们存在不同观点，一部分批评结局突兀，另一部分认为应将系列看作整体。
  • A 选项：文本重点不是说《怒海争锋》结构使其成为最复杂的书，该选项错误。
  • B 选项：准确指出评论家对奥伯里 - 马图林系列小说结构的有效性存在不同看法，符合文意。
  • C 选项：文中未提及评论家对该系列小说是否应与《福尔赛世家》享有同等文学声誉的争议，该选项错误。
  • D 选项：文中没有提到评论家认为该系列小说尽管结构有缺陷但极具娱乐性，该选项错误。
综上，正确答案是 B

questions.article: "The Monster" is an 1898 story by Stephen Crane. In the story, the character of Jim, a young boy, accidentally damages a peony (a flower) in the yard while his father is tending to the lawn. Crane depicts the dedication and care with which his father typically cares for his lawn, writing, ______
questions.question: Which quotation from "The Monster" most effectively illustrates the claim?

options.name: A
options.content: "After some trouble [Jim's father] found the subject of the incident, the broken flower. Turning then, he saw the child lurking at the rear and scanning his countenance."

options.name: B
options.content: "[Jim's father] was shaving this lawn as if it were a priest's chin. All during the season he had worked at it in the coolness and peace of the evenings after supper. Even in the shadow of the cherry trees the grass was strong and healthy."

options.name: C
options.content: "[Jim's father] paused, and with the howl of the machine no longer occupying the sense, one could hear the robins in the cherry trees arranging their affairs."

options.name: D
options.content: "[Jim] went on to the lawn, very slowly, and kicking wretchedly at the turf. Presently his father came along with the whirring machine, while the sweet, new grass blades spun from the knives."

questions.correct: "[Jim's father] was shaving this lawn as if it were a priest's chin. All during the season he had worked at it in the coolness and peace of the evenings after supper. Even in the shadow of the cherry trees the grass was strong and healthy."

questions.article: In a college course on urban affairs, a student asserts that increased traffic congestion in the 1990s in the United States was present both in very large cities such as New York City, New York, and smaller areas such as Allentown-Bethlehem, Pennsylvania, and Beaumont, Texas; though those smaller areas may have been less affected by traffic congestion than very large cities, this congestion also worsened in them over time.
questions.question: Which choice best describes data from the graph that support the student's claim?

options.name: A
options.content: While the number of hours of traffic delay per commuter per year was always lower in the Allentown-Bethlehem, Pennsylvania area than in the New York City, New York area for each year between 1990 and 2000, the amount of traffic delay rose in both areas during this period.

options.name: B
options.content: In at least one of the three urban areas shown, the amount of traffic delay was less than 20 hours per person per year at one point between 1990 and 2000.

options.name: C
options.content: In 1992, the amount of traffic delay in the New York City, New York area was less than 20 hours per commuter per year.

options.name: D
options.content: Throughout the period between 1990 and 2000, the annual amount of traffic delay per commuter was greater in the Allentown-Bethlehem, Pennsylvania area than in the New York City, New York area.

questions.correct: While the number of hours of traffic delay per commuter per year was always lower in the Allentown-Bethlehem, Pennsylvania area than in the New York City, New York area for each year between 1990 and 2000, the amount of traffic delay rose in both areas during this period.

questions.article: Biologist Rosanna Alegado believes that we might learn how multicellular organisms developed from single-celled ones if we understand why the single-celled organism Salpingoeca rosetta, the oldest living relative of animals, sometimes forms colonies of cells. Alegado and colleagues reviewed data from many studies of how S. rosetta responds when exposed to another type of single-celled organism, bacteria, including John P. Bowman's work with Algoriphagus ratkowskyi bacteria and Iftikhar Ahmed's work with Algoriphagus boritolerans bacteria. Alegado and colleagues concluded that both A. ratkowskyi and A. boritolerans might have played a role in the development of multicellular organisms.
questions.question: Which finding, if true, would most directly support Alegado and colleagues' conclusion?

options.name: A
options.content: Bowman and Ahmed found that S. rosetta tended to form colonies after bacterial exposure.

options.name: B
options.content: Bowman found that S. rosetta tended to form colonies after bacterial exposure, but Ahmed did not.

options.name: C
options.content: Ahmed found that S. rosetta tended to form colonies after bacterial exposure, but Bowman did not.

options.name: D
options.content: Neither Bowman nor Ahmed found that S. rosetta tended to form colonies after bacterial exposure.

questions.correct: Bowman and Ahmed found that S. rosetta tended to form colonies after bacterial exposure.
questions.solution:
翻译：
生物学家罗桑娜・阿莱加多认为，如果我们能理解单细胞生物 —— 动物现存最古老的近亲长领水螅（Salpingoeca rosetta）为何有时会形成细胞群体，或许就能了解多细胞生物是如何从单细胞生物进化而来的。阿莱加多及其同事回顾了许多关于长领水螅在接触另一种单细胞生物 —— 细菌时如何反应的研究数据，这些研究包括约翰・P・鲍曼对拉氏食藻菌（Algoriphagus ratkowskyi）的研究，以及伊夫蒂哈尔・艾哈迈德对耐盐食藻菌（Algoriphagus boritolerans）的研究。阿莱加多及其同事得出结论：拉氏食藻菌和耐盐食藻菌可能都在多细胞生物的进化过程中发挥了作用。
翻译：
13. 以下哪项发现如果为真，能最直接支持阿莱加多及其同事的结论？
解析：
阿莱加多及其同事的结论是拉氏食藻菌和耐盐食藻菌可能在多细胞生物进化中发挥作用，其依据是长领水螅接触细菌后的反应。如果长领水螅接触细菌后倾向于形成细胞群体，就更能支持细菌在多细胞生物进化中发挥作用这一结论。
  • A 选项：鲍曼和艾哈迈德都发现长领水螅在接触细菌后倾向于形成细胞群体，这为细菌在多细胞生物进化中发挥作用提供了有力支持，能直接支持结论。
  • B 选项：鲍曼发现长领水螅接触细菌后形成细胞群体，而艾哈迈德未发现，结果不一致，不能有力支持结论。
  • C 选项：艾哈迈德发现长领水螅接触细菌后形成细胞群体，而鲍曼未发现，结果不一致，不能有力支持结论。
  • D 选项：鲍曼和艾哈迈德都未发现长领水螅接触细菌后形成细胞群体，这会削弱结论，而不是支持。
综上，正确答案是 A

questions.article: Biologist Rosanna Alegado believes that we might learn how multicellular organisms developed from single-celled ones if we understand why the single-celled organism Salpingoeca rosetta, the oldest living relative of animals, sometimes forms colonies of cells. Alegado and colleagues reviewed data from many studies about how S. rosetta responds when exposed to another type of single-celled organism, bacteria, including Edward G. Ruby's work with Vibrio fischeri bacteria and Ana M. Cerdeño-Tárraga's work with Bacteroides fragilis bacteria. Alegado and colleagues concluded that neither V. fischeri nor B. fragilis are likely to have played a significant role in the development of multicellular organisms.
questions.question: Which finding, if true, would most directly support Alegado and colleagues' conclusion?

options.name: A
options.content: S. rosetta tended to form colonies when exposed to V. fischeri and when exposed to B. fragilis.

options.name: B
options.content: S. rosetta tended to form colonies when exposed to V. fischeri, but not when exposed to B. fragilis.

options.name: C
options.content: S. rosetta tended to form colonies when exposed to B. fragilis, but not when exposed to V. fischeri.

options.name: D
options.content: S. rosetta did not tend to form colonies when exposed to either V. fischeri or B. fragilis.

questions.correct: S. rosetta did not tend to form colonies when exposed to either V. fischeri or B. fragilis.

questions.article: Previous research has shown that plant species with a narrow geographical range tend to be more genetically homogeneous than plant species with extensive ranges are. Based on these findings, researchers recently ran simulations to predict how the genetic variation of several species of Mammillaria, a genus of cactus found throughout the Americas, might change in different distribution conditions. One of these species, M. anniana, is found only in the state of Tamaulipas. The researchers simulated what would happen if M. anniana spread to new habitats outside Tamaulipas, and, consistent with previous findings, the results showed that ______
questions.question: Which choice most logically completes the text?

options.name: A
options.content: there was a gradual increase in the genetic homogeneity of Mammillaria species in states neighboring Tamaulipas.

options.name: B
options.content: Mammillaria species other than M. anniana would become more common in Tamaulipas.

options.name: C
options.content: several other Mammillaria species could survive in Tamaulipas in the future.

options.name: D
options.content: the genetic homogeneity of M. anniana decreased over time.

questions.correct: the genetic homogeneity of M. anniana decreased over time.

questions.article: In the periodic table, an element's atomic number indicates the number of protons in an atom of that element. For example, there are 25 protons in a manganese atom. Raymond Chang's textbook General Chemistry: The Essential Concepts ______ this concept in detail.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of standard English?

options.name: A
options.content: discussing

options.name: B
options.content: discusses

options.name: C
options.content: to discuss

options.name: D
options.content: having discussed

questions.correct: discusses
questions.solution:
考点：谓语动词和非谓语动词
主语是the textbook，这个句子需要谓语动词，因此正确答案是B。
翻译：
在元素周期表中，一种元素的原子序数表示该元素原子中的质子数。例如，一个锰原子中有 25 个质子。张祖德（Raymond Chang）的教科书《普通化学：基本概念》____这个概念的详细内容。
16. 以下哪个选项能使文本符合标准英语的规范？
解析：
  • 此句缺少谓语动词。
  • A 选项 “discussing” 是现在分词形式，不能单独作谓语，不符合要求。
  • B 选项 “discusses” 是动词第三人称单数形式，可作谓语，“Raymond Chang's textbook” 是单数主语，用 “discusses” 符合主谓一致原则，能使句子语法正确。
  • C 选项 “to discuss” 是动词不定式，不能作谓语，不符合要求。
  • D 选项 “having discussed” 是现在分词的完成式，也不能单独作谓语，不符合要求。
综上，正确答案是 B

questions.article: An emulsifier is a type of compound that ______ to stabilize an emulsion—a mixture of two or more liquids that otherwise would not easily blend together. In the cosmetics industry, emulsifiers like cetostearyl alcohol are commonly used to blend oil and water into homogeneous formulations, like lotions and perfumes.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of standard English?

options.name: A
options.content: served

options.name: B
options.content: had served

options.name: C
options.content: serves

options.name: D
options.content: was serving

questions.correct: serves

questions.article: Over the years, dozens of architectural and archaeological sites important to Hawaiian history and culture—such as Grove Farm, Kilauea School, and the Hana Belt Road—have been added to an important ______ Hawai'i Register of Historic Places. New sites are added each year, as decided by a review board of experts including sociologist Alton Okinaka, architect Katle Stephens, and historian Bill Souza.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of standard English?

options.name: A
options.content: list: the

options.name: B
options.content: list. The

options.name: C
options.content: list; the

options.name: D
options.content: list the

questions.correct: list: the

questions.article: Today, the Michelin Guide is widely known as the arbiter of fine dining, but when it was created in 1990, it was little more than a marketing gimmick. Brothers Andre and Edouard Michelin sought to increase profits for their tire company by encouraging their customers to drive across France, visiting the guide's recommended hotels and ______ as it grew in scope and influence, the guide had its modest French eateries replaced with the best restaurants from around the world, including The Eight in Macau and Sushi Ueda in Nagoya.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of standard English?

options.name: A
options.content: restaurants

options.name: B
options.content: restaurants;

options.name: C
options.content: restaurants and

options.name: D
options.content: restaurants,

questions.correct: restaurants;

questions.article: In their research, behavioral ______ integrate methods from psychology and economics to analyze how and why people make particular choices and to examine the broader implications of those choices for the economy.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

options.name: A
options.content: economists Laura Gee and Muriel Niederle,

options.name: B
options.content: economists Laura Gee and Muriel Niederle

options.name: C
options.content: economists Laura Gee, and Muriel Niederle,

options.name: D
options.content: economists, Laura Gee and Muriel Niederle,

questions.correct: economists Laura Gee and Muriel Niederle
questions.solution: title和name之间没有逗号，看成一个整体词组，所以正确答案是B。

questions.article: The city of Jinan, China, expanded its rapid transit system, the Jinan Metro, as recently as 2020. ______ the system will likely need to undergo further expansions as the size and needs of the city's population shift.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical transition?

options.name: A
options.content: Still,

options.name: B
options.content: By contrast,

options.name: C
options.content: For example,

options.name: D
options.content: Instead,

questions.correct: Still,
questions.solution:
翻译：
中国济南市在 2020 年才刚刚扩建了其快速交通系统 ---- 济南地铁。____随着城市人口规模和需求的变化，该系统可能仍需进一步扩建。
解析：
  • 前文提到济南地铁在 2020 年刚扩建，后文说随着人口变化仍需进一步扩建，存在转折关系。
  • A 选项 “Still” 有 “尽管如此；仍然” 的意思，可用于表示转折，符合前后文逻辑关系。
  • B 选项 “By contrast” 意为 “相比之下” ，用于对比不同事物，此处并非对比关系，不符合语境。
  • C 选项 “For example” 是 “例如” 的意思，用于举例说明，这里不需要举例，不符合语境。
  • D 选项 “Instead” 表示 “反而；代替” ，不符合此处逻辑关系。
综上，正确答案是 A

questions.article: Theater industry veteran Robert Tang admits that his ambitions weren't very lofty when he created the Asian American Theater Revue, a website that documents information about Asian American theaters like Second Generation Productions in New York City, New York: "Everyone had a site, so I had to have one, too." ______ his site has become an essential resource for industry professionals looking to learn more about Asian American plays, playwrights, theater festivals, and more.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical transition?

options.name: A
options.content: Nevertheless,

options.name: B
options.content: Therefore,

options.name: C
options.content: Furthermore,

options.name: D
options.content: Next,

questions.correct: Nevertheless,
questions.solution:
翻译：
戏剧界资深人士罗伯特・唐承认，他创建《亚裔美国人戏剧评论》网站时，志向并不高远。该网站记录了像纽约市第二代制作公司等亚裔美国人剧院的相关信息，他说：“大家都有网站，所以我也得有一个。”____ 他的网站已成为行业专业人士深入了解亚裔美国人戏剧、剧作家、戏剧节等内容的重要资源。
解析：
前文提到罗伯特创建网站时志向不高，后文说网站成为重要资源，存在转折关系。
  • A 选项 “Nevertheless” 意为 “然而；尽管如此” ，用于表示转折，符合前后文逻辑。
  • B 选项 “Therefore” 表示 “因此” ，用于因果关系，此处不是因果关系，不符合语境。
  • C 选项 “Furthermore” 意思是 “此外；而且” ，用于补充说明，不符合转折语境。
  • D 选项 “Next” 表示 “接下来” ，用于时间或顺序上的承接，不符合此处逻辑。
综上，正确答案是 A

questions.article: The first documented use of the English word "session" is attributed to poet Geoffrey Chaucer's 1386 work Canterbury Prologue. However, Chaucer didn't write in Modern English; ______ he wrote in what we now call Middle English, which was commonly used during the period.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical transition?

options.name: A
options.content: rather,

options.name: B
options.content: as a result,

options.name: C
options.content: similarly,

options.name: D
options.content: finally,

questions.correct: rather,
questions.solution:
翻译：
英语单词 “session” 有记载的首次使用可追溯到诗人杰弗里・乔叟 1386 年的作品《坎特伯雷故事集・序言》。然而，乔叟并非用现代英语写作；____他用的是我们现在所说的中世纪英语，这在当时很常用。
解析：
前文否定了乔叟用现代英语写作，后文指出他用中世纪英语写作，存在进一步说明的关系。前面出现否定，后面使用rather。表达“不是……而是”的逻辑。
  • A 选项 “rather” 有 “而是；相反” 的意思，用于纠正或进一步说明，符合此处逻辑。
  • B 选项 “as a result” 意为 “结果” ，用于因果关系，这里不是因果关系，不符合语境。
  • C 选项 “similarly” 表示 “同样地” ，用于类比，不符合此处逻辑。
  • D 选项 “finally” 意思是 “最后” ，用于表示顺序或总结，不符合语境。
综上，正确答案是 A

questions.article:
While researching a topic, a student has taken the following notes:

  • Kale is a vegetable that contains ascorbic acid, an essential nutrient for humans.
  • Blueberries are fruits that contain ascorbic acid.
  • There is 120 milligrams (mg) of ascorbic acid per every 100 grams (g) of kale.
  • There is 10 mg of ascorbic acid per every 100 g of blueberries.
  • Humans cannot make ascorbic acid in their bodies, so they must get it from foods, including fruits and vegetables.
  • Ascorbic acid is also known as vitamin C.
questions.question: The student wants to make and support a claim that kale is a better source of vitamin C than blueberries are. Which choice most effectively uses relevant information from the notes to accomplish this goal?

options.name: A
options.content: Kale contains ascorbic acid (which humans cannot make in their bodies), and blueberries do too.

options.name: B
options.content: Blueberries contain 10 mg of vitamin C per 100 g, but kale is a better source of vitamin C; in fact, kale contains 120 mg per 100 g.

options.name: C
options.content: Kale is a better source of vitamin C, also known as ascorbic acid, than blueberries are.

options.name: D
options.content: Humans must get vitamin C from foods like kale and blueberries because they cannot make it in their bodies.

questions.correct: Blueberries contain 10 mg of vitamin C per 100 g, but kale is a better source of vitamin C; in fact, kale contains 120 mg per 100 g.

questions.article:
While researching a topic, a student has taken the following notes:

  • The Mohs scale of mineral hardness is a ten-point scale that orders minerals by hardness based on their ability to scratch other minerals.
  • Minerals with larger numbers are harder than minerals with smaller numbers and can leave visible scratches on them.
  • Minerals with smaller numbers are softer than minerals with larger numbers and cannot leave visible scratches on them.
  • The mineral calcite has a Mohs scale number of 3.
  • The mineral apatite has a Mohs scale number of 5.
  • The mineral topaz has a Mohs scale number of 8.
questions.question: The student wants to explain how hard apatite is in relation to other minerals. Which choice most effectively uses relevant information from the notes to accomplish this goal?

options.name: A
options.content: In the Mohs scale of mineral hardness, topaz (8) is ranked higher than calcite (3).

options.name: B
options.content: Calcite, topaz, and apatite can be ordered by their ability to leave visible scratches on other minerals.

options.name: C
options.content: Topaz has a Mohs scale number of 8, which means that it can scratch not only calcite but also apatite.

options.name: D
options.content: Apatite has a Mohs scale number of 5, which means that it is harder than calcite (3) but softer than topaz (8).

questions.correct: Apatite has a Mohs scale number of 5, which means that it is harder than calcite (3) but softer than topaz (8).

questions.article:
While researching a topic, a student has taken the following notes:

  • Epistolary novels are novels written primarily as a series of fictional documents, typically letters.
  • Sometimes, the documents are journal entries, newspaper clippings, and more.
  • Julie, or The New Heloise (1761) is an epistolary novel by French author Jean-Jacques Rousseau.
  • It consists primarily of letters sent between a man and a woman in a small French town.
  • Absolutely Normal Chaos (1990) is an epistolary novel by American author Sharon Creech.
  • It consists primarily of journal entries written by a student during her summer vacation.
questions.question: The student wants to emphasize a difference between the two novels. Which choice most effectively uses relevant information from the notes to accomplish this goal?

options.name: A
options.content: The French author Jean-Jacques Rousseau and the American author Sharon Creech have written epistolary novels.

options.name: B
options.content: While Julie, or The New Heloise and Absolutely Normal Chaos are both epistolary novels, the former is composed primarily of letters and the latter of journal entries.

options.name: C
options.content: Some epistolary novels consist primarily or journal entries, but most, like Jean-Jacques Rousseau's Julie, or The New Heloise, consist primarily of letters.

options.name: D
options.content: Jean-Jacques Rousseau's Julie, or The New Heloise and Sharon Creech's Absolutely Normal Chaos demonstrate the variety of documents that can be used in epistolary novels.

questions.correct: While Julie, or The New Heloise and Absolutely Normal Chaos are both epistolary novels, the former is composed primarily of letters and the latter of journal entries.

questions.article:
While researching a topic, a student has taken the following notes:

  • Most of the plant and bird species in Oahu, Hawaii, are non-native.
  • In a 2019 study, researchers wanted to know what role non-native birds play in dispersing plant seeds in Oahu.
  • Researchers catalogued plant seeds found in fecal samples from nonnative birds.
  • Leptecophylla tameiameiae, a flowering shrub, was one of fifteen native species catalogued.
  • Passiflora suberosa, an herbaceous vine, was one of twenty-nine non-native species catalogued.
  • Researchers concluded that non-native birds play a vital role in dispersing the seeds of native and non-native plants.
questions.question: The student wants to compare the number of native and non-native species catalogued. Which choice most effectively uses relevant information from the notes to accomplish this goal?

options.name: A
options.content: Seeds from Leptecophylla tameiameiae and Passiflora suberosa can be found in Oahu, Hawaii, but only the former plant is native.

options.name: B
options.content: In 2019, researchers catalogued native and non-native plant seeds found in fecal samples from non-native birds.

options.name: C
options.content: Most of the birds in Oahu, Hawaii, are non-native, and researchers have concluded that they play a vital role in seed dispersal.

options.name: D
options.content: When cataloguing plant seeds found in bird fecal samples, researchers found more non-native seed species than native species.

questions.correct: When cataloguing plant seeds found in bird fecal samples, researchers found more non-native seed species than native species.
